chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Tietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
104 days jail credit if probation is revoked (per court officer)
Consecutive to: to any sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, fines, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
